summary: Email correspondence between Daniel Besselsen of Interlochen Center for the Arts and an Assistant U.S. Attorney regarding the provision of student admissions files (referenced as GX 742 and 743) and travel arrangements for Besselsen. The email includes attachments related to the Epstein case and mentions the renaming of the 'Epstein Scholarship Lodge' to 'Green Lake Lodge'.

persons.name: Daniel Besselsen
persons.role: Assistant Vice President of Finance at Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Correspondent providing student admissions files (GX 742 and 743) and information about the renamed 'Epstein Scholarship Lodge' to the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney
persons.role: Prosecutor from the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Requesting student admissions files and travel information from Daniel Besselsen for case-related purposes.

connections.description: Besselsen is providing documents and information to the prosecutor in response to official requests related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Initial travel information request
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney requests travel details from Daniel Besselsen for witness coordination.

events.title: Follow-up request for admissions files
events.description: Prosecutor follows up to request the rest of the admissions files for students referenced in GX 742 and 743.

events.title: Document submission and lodge renaming information
events.description: Daniel Besselsen sends requested admissions files and notes the renaming of 'Epstein Scholarship Lodge' to 'Green Lake Lodge'.

locations: Green Lake Lodge (formerly Epstein Scholarship Lodge)
keyFacts: Interlochen Center for Arts had a building named 'Epstein Scholarship Lodge' which was renamed to 'Green Lake Lodge'.
The U.S. Attorney's office requested admissions files for specific students referenced as GX 742 and 743, indicating these students may be relevant to the Epstein case.
Daniel Besselsen, a finance executive at Interlochen, is coordinating with prosecutors to provide documents and potentially travel as a witness.
The correspondence shows ongoing investigative efforts by the Southern District of New York in 2021 regarding Epstein-related matters.
